section.name: maven-buildmetadata-plugin
section.p: This Maven plugin generates build meta data and provides it as Maven build properties. The properties are written to a properties file that can be included in the generated artifact. The information can also be added to the manifest file.

ol.li:
SCM information
revision number
revision date
locally modified files
URL of SCM server

Java runtime
vendor
name
version
virtual machine
compiler
JAVA_OPTS

Maven execution information
Maven version
active profiles
environment properties
command line and executed goals
MAVEN_OPTS

Artifact and version
group ID
artifact ID
build version

project info
home page URL
categories
tags

section.p: For detailed information about the collected meta data and the properties that store them, please consult the listing of the build properties.

If your desired meta data is not included in the list, this is no show stopper! The Provider SPI allows you to add own implementations to provide additional meta data from any source and even export build information to remote systems.

subsection.name: Why add Meta Data to the Artifact?
subsection.p: Imagine the product is running on an application server. The product manager want to know,

ul.li: which version of which artifact is currently running on that server?
which artifact maps to which source code version in the SCM repository?
what configuration set (including profiles and environment variables) has been used to generate the artifact?
on which machine was the artifact built?

subsection.p: If you have no answers to these questions, but love to have, this tool is for you. It allows you to add this information easily as meta data to all kinds of Java archives.
The following sections show the artifacts provided by this plugin.

subsection.name: Properties File
subsection.p: The generated properties file is per default added to the META-INF folder of the archive and can be easily accessed at runtime. It contains the following information:

subsection.name: Manifest File
subsection.p: The generated information can be used in the Manifest file, using the maven-jar-plugin.
subsection.source:

subsection.p: The information is not added automatically, but requires to be edited manually. Please refer to Use with JAR plugin for details.
Please note that other archive type can be configured similarly with e.g. the maven-ear-plugin or maven-war-plugin.

subsection.name: Report
subsection.p: To map a site documentation to an artifact (and vice versa), a build report can be integrated into the site documentation. This report contains build information like the revision and revision date.
The Build Report of this project may serve as an example.
